summary: Tribe explores the concept of modern tribalism in our interconnected world. It delves into how technology and digital platforms have created new forms of community and identity, often leading to echo chambers and polarization. This theme examines the balance between global connectivity and local affiliations, highlighting the complexities of human relationships in the digital age. It touches on the power dynamics in communication channels and the challenges of maintaining diverse perspectives in an increasingly tribal online landscape.
excerpt: Marshall McLuhan's "global village" concept predicts technology connecting the world leads to simultaneous existence and new tribalism. This manifests in today's digital landscape with social media echo chambers and online communities.
